data.title: Writing Excellence Unleashed
data.body:
Title: Writing Excellence Unleashed - 5 Stars for Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen!

I am thrilled to share my overwhelmingly positive experience with the Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen in Black Ink, Medium Point (1.0mm). Having purchased an 18-pack of these pens a couple of months ago, I am delighted to award them a well-deserved 5-star rating. The Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens have become an indispensable part of my daily writing routine, offering a flawless writing experience that exceeds expectations.

Smooth and Consistent Ink Flow (5/5):
The Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens boast an unparalleled smoothness in ink flow. Writing with these pens is a joy, as the ink glides effortlessly across paper, creating a consistently bold and clear line. The reliable ink flow ensures a seamless writing experience with every stroke.

Medium Point Precision (5/5):
The medium point (1.0mm) of these pens strikes the perfect balance between precision and boldness. Whether taking notes, jotting down ideas, or engaging in detailed writing tasks, the medium point delivers a crisp and well-defined line. It caters to a variety of writing styles with ease.

Comfortable Grip Design (5/5):
The Z-Grip lives up to its name with a comfortable grip design that ensures fatigue-free writing. The ergonomic shape of the pen provides a secure and pleasant grip, allowing for extended periods of writing without discomfort. The thoughtfully designed grip adds to the overall writing pleasure.

Retractable Convenience (5/5):
The retractable feature of these pens adds an extra layer of convenience to their design. The ability to retract the pen with a simple click prevents accidental ink stains and ensures that the pen is ready for use at a moment's notice. The retractable mechanism enhances the overall functionality of the pens.

Long-Lasting Durability (5/5):
These pens have proven to be exceptionally durable, standing up to the demands of daily use. The construction of the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens ensures that they withstand the test of time without compromising on performance. The long-lasting durability adds value to the purchase.

Bold and Vibrant Black Ink (5/5):
The black ink in these pens is bold, vibrant, and consistently delivers a professional finish. Whether writing on standard paper or more porous surfaces, the ink maintains its richness, providing a clear and legible result. The black ink's quality enhances the overall writing experience.

Versatile for Various Writing Tasks (5/5):
These pens are versatile and excel in various writing tasks. From everyday note-taking to more detailed writing assignments, the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens adapt effortlessly. Their versatility makes them a reliable choice for a wide range of writing scenarios.

Packaging Convenience (5/5):
The 18-pack packaging of these pens offers great value for money. With an ample supply of pens, I never have to worry about running out during critical writing moments. The convenient packaging ensures that I always have a reliable Z-Grip pen within reach.

Affordable Excellence (5/5):
The affordability of the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens is a standout feature. Despite their premium performance, these pens come at a price point that makes them accessible for daily use. The combination of excellence and affordability makes them an outstanding choice.

Overall Writing Joy (5/5):
In conclusion, the Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen has transformed my writing experience, delivering unparalleled smoothness, precision, and durability. These pens have become a daily companion, enhancing my writing tasks with their ergonomic design and reliable ink flow. A resounding 5-star rating – Zebra Pen continues to set the standard for writing excellence!

data.title: Great quality and long lasting!!!
data.body: I bought these pens a long time ago and I still didn't finish the pack, the ink lasts a long time and there are a lot of pens in the pack, the pen isn't the smoothest pen out there, but it's relatively smooth compared to most pens which makes it very nice to use. It's also very convenient that there is a nice clip on it which makes it easy to carry around and hard to loose. I think the price was great for the amount of pens it came with and for how long it lasted me for!!!

data.title: My Daughter Loves Them !!!
data.body: These Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pens are a lifesaver for my daughter's homework! With a smooth 1.0mm medium point and low viscosity black ink, they make writing a breeze and help her finish her assignments quickly. The soft rubberized grip ensures she can write comfortably for extended periods, and the convenient metal pocket clip means she can always have her favorite pen on hand. Plus, the vivid black ink and solid construction make these pens perfect for everyday use. They're a must-have for any student's pencil case!

data.title: Not Annoying
data.body: Why are so many pens crappy? I like a pen that I can click from the top, writes smoothly, and doesn't run out quickly. I write constantly at work. I need a decent pen. It doesn't have to be THE BEST PEN EVER. It just has to function without being obnoxious throughout the day. And not cost a fortune. It's a pen, after all, and ends up just getting thrown away. These pens are great. They do not stop working all of a sudden with easy ink flow. Seem to last a while. Clicker at the end. Grip is fine.

data.title: good quality
data.body: great for the price

data.title: Smooth
data.body: I get so many compliments on these pens. They have good grip and write smooth. I would purchase again.

data.title: Easy to hold
data.body: Good quality, nice ink flow, and easy to hold.

data.title: I love these pens
data.body: They glide well across the paper. They don't smudge or leave ink blots. I write quite a bit throughout the day, and I often choose to use these pens because they are comfortable and don't bleed through the paper.

data.title: A few colors are too light - fine point would be better
data.body: A few colors were so light you could barely see them on the paper. They are medium point and the ink doesn’t flow well. Fine point would work better. I did not return them only because they were not expensive. They did state medium point, and I needed colored pens.

data.title: It is good pens

data.title: I need pens every day
data.body: I use these pens to do my Spanish course on Duolingo

data.title: Pentastic Performance
data.body: These pens were perfect for our baby shower games and the ink is top quality.

data.title: Pens
data.body: A lot of pens, all the same color and size. They have all worked so far.

data.title: Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen, Medium Point, 1.0mm Blue Ink 24 pack.
data.body: I think this is the best value for your money. However, I hate that the next morning when one tries to write with the pen it acts as if it is out of ink. Trying to get the pen to write again is a nuisance. I will try some other ball point pen next time and pay a little more to see if there is something better that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.

data.title: Nice pens
data.body: Smooth and easy writing.

data.title: A "zensational" value pen
data.body: It can be sluggish to start writing, the ink flow may be a bit temperamental sometimes, and the pen construction could use improvement. That being said, I still give the Zebra Z-Grip 4 stars mainly because less than $9 gets you 24 pens that write like much more expensive pens...and also feel like more expensive pens in the hand. I find the Z-Grip to be particularly comfortable to write with, and the ink is very smooth and vibrant for a budget pen. The metal pocket clip is also a nice touch at this price level. Like the Bic Round Stic, the Zebra Z-Grip is one of those humble workhorse pens that you'll find floating around restaurants, piled high in the supply cabinet at your office, or you may be using one to fill out paperwork at the doctor's office. However, I really like using the pen for my personal needs because it's so smooth and comfortable with boldly-colored ink. I recommend it, especially for people wanting a super-smooth pen at a super-reasonable price.

data.title: Pull off little protective cap on the ball point on every pen before use !!!!
data.body: These pens are light weight and comfortable to hold and write smoothly and no runny ink . Great price can't go wrong and fits in your pocket nicely . ONE thing to remember is before using a new one , they have a little protective cap on the ball point of every pen you have to pull off before use . Probably to prevent any air getting at the ink and so they won't dry up say 8 months from now just sitting in the package they came in . I read some of the reviews and people were saying they don't work , so I was unsure whether to buy them or not , so when I got them I couldn't wait to try one to see how well they work and sure enough I could see what the problem was , just as I thought . They all had the little plastic rubber protective cap on every one . Easy enough just grab with your finger and pull it off and your all set !!!

data.title: Good for a cheap pen
data.body:
If you’re looking for cheap pens these are good. They write smoothly and I like the feel. Two big problems I saw with them (but again, you kind of get what you pay for):

They run out of ink pretty fast. I’ve been a little disappointed with how fast I run through the ink. I write a bit, but not an abnormal amount. Really just in my journal every day, and usually only a few pages at most (small 5x7-ish sized notebook). But luckily the package is large, so I’m not too worried about that. Just may.l not be the most cost-effective option if you’re buying for an office or other environment where you will be writing a lot.

The other thing I haven’t loved is the speed that the ink leaves the pen. If I’m just writing it seems to work fairly well, with only a few letters here and there coming out slightly faded. But if you try to draw a line (I usually put a line between journal entries so I can maximize page usage… because I use my journals a lot), it fades halfway across my page (again, it’s only like 4-5” across…). So not super ideal for anything more than regular text writing or something along those lines. Any continuous lines tend to run out of ink and you have the lift the pen and start again. Maybe a weird complaint, but I know people who use these types of pens for art and other things like that - so I would not recommend these for that.

Overall, even with these complaints, I feel like for the price, these are pretty good pens. I’ve liked them and it was nice to get so many in a package.

data.title: Great ink + smooth writing for the fastest drying time and cheapest price!
data.body:
I have finally found my favorite pens for serving! I love pens. I am obsessed with them and I try everything. But while it's easy to find the nicest thickest ink pens, the ones I use when I'm home, and judge those...it's arguably much harder to find the "best cheap pen." I mean, a good ballpoint pen is hard to find, period! That's why I only use them when I have to.

I have had a consistent issue when it comes to my job as a server in a restaurant. The pens that write nice and thick and smoothly (which they need to as I have <5 seconds to write down everything my guest is saying) then transfer ink onto my hands and onto my receipts and everything else in my book once I shut it. Still, I would rather take some messy ink transfer than be struggling to get out any ink in the first place and cramp up my hand from having to use so much pressure at a hard angle (as required by other ballpoint pens). This is why I have just been using nicer ballpoint pens and doing my best to mitigate the mess. Bottomline: I need ink to come out fast and dry fast and it's been a struggle

Until I just happened upon one of these...and immediately rushed to order more! This is legitimately the first pen I have found that writes and produces ink as well as it does while simultaneously drying as fast as it does and therefore transferring ink as little as it does. While I don't know if I'll ever find a perfect balance, these pens are my new favorite. They last pretty well, especially for the price. They are very comfortable to hold and use - balancing weight, width, and size well. The biggest standout again, is how quickly they dry. I would be paying a lot more for these if I had to!

My main complaint is that the bottom tip unscrews. Something that of course most pens can do (and something that is a problem for some pens more than others). It is pretty bad for these ones in particular. I haven't had one burst or fall apart; it's only as I'm writing the tip starts to unscrew and fall down and I have to quickly screw it back into place so it keeps working/producing ink. This happens a lot more when I'm using these pens vs. others. I would almost prefer them to dry out quicker vs. coming apart so quickly!

I am putting them under a lot of stress though, as you can imagine. I don't think they would cause me nearly as much trouble otherwise.

data.title: I needed a pen
data.body:
How can one review a pen?
They work and that is all I asked. I needed a pen and got tired of looking for one and then finding it was out of ink (my wife never throws them away) so I bought a whole pack of them!

data.title: Ok
data.body: I purchased these as I go through pens quickly. They are ok. I have used a Zebra pen in the past. The slimmer metal ones. Went to these as the other runs dry too quickly. These Zebra pens do not write that smooth. The ink is rather dull. Won’t purchase again. Picky about the pens I write with. Would be great for kids to use for school though. Good value.

data.title: Black and Blue stop working once it gets to the grip line
data.body: I love the color, and the variety of these pens, but the black and blue stop working right about the time the get to the grip point. you can see there is still ink on them, but they just stop, funny enough the other colors all work with out a problem.

data.title: Love them
data.body: I will buy more

data.title: Nice
data.body: Nice and smooth when using this pen. The only complaint would be that you have to scribble on a separate piece of paper to get the ink to start flowing.

data.title: Favorite pens
data.body: I use these pens everyday for work and the pack is worth the $10.

data.title: Great grip
data.body: This pen has a great grip, writes nice and last. My favorite pen.

data.title: Great pens
data.body: The Zebra pens have impressed me because the ink lasts much longer than the expensive gel pens on the market. The ink comes out in a steady flow so that there are no skips/bare spots when writing. I actually bought a blue pack AND a black pack so I may be set for life with ink pens.

data.title: LOVE`
data.body: I usually go with my go to with are G2 pens. I love how these pens are similar, but these do not bleed through paper. These pens also dry quick on paper (no smudges). Others have asked about these pens when they refuse to return my pens back! Lol.

data.title: Not as great as I expected
data.body: Not that bright colors, very dull on white paper :(
Great everyday pens

data.title: Nice pens.
data.body: Nice pens. Write well. Great colors. Would purchase again.

data.title: Nice.
data.body: Really good buy. Writes smooth and colors show up really good. Highly recommend.

data.title: This is the pen you've been looking for.
data.body:
I'm one of those weird people who finds a pen and then buys only that pen for years.. like ten years or even more. I did that for a long time with extra fine point Sharpie pens. That is, until I found these.

You see, I went to a restaurant and the waiter gave me one of these pens to sign the receipt. The grip was comfortable, the writing was SMOOTH, and the ink was beautiful. I took like five photos of the pen and then found them here on Amazon and immediately bought what can only be considered a bushel of them. These are now my go-to pens. I don't use anything else.

I know I'm old when I find such pleasure in a simple pen, but that's fine by me. Sometimes it's the simple pleasures in life that you enjoy the most, and every time I write something down I get reminded that these pens are really enjoyable to write with.

data.title: Great pens for teachers!
data.body:
These pens are a great quality. They don’t dry out or break. I use each pen until it complete runs out of ink. I bought a pack of 40 and they lasted five years, and I just bought my second pack. I use these for grading and my students love the unusual colors. I tried another brand and they didn’t last anywhere near as long. Just FYI, they are traditional ink, not gel. Buy these, you won’t regret it.
P.S. This is NOT part of any promotion, I just really like these pens, LOL!

data.title: It functioned as it was supposed to
data.body: It functioned as it was supposed to

data.title: Not a Shade of Red I expected, will order something else
data.body: Was not expecting the shade of Red this had as opposed to what I was used to using. I was using a deep shade of red and very happy with that ....well I ordered this one and its almost like florescent or something...kind of more hue of pink/red than the deep red I wanted. This package costs too little to ship back, so I will just order something else and drop these off at the local school for the teachers to use them as I will never use them. The box says "Advanced Red Ink"...but I wasn't expecting something so juvenile in shade or tint.

data.body: The colors are nice and so’s the grip, but the ink blobs. So essentially falls short at the one thing a pen should do.

data.title: They're alright
data.body: Half of them don't work but the one's that do make it seem like your penmanship is equal to those of Shakespearean times.

data.title: Comfortable

data.title: I don't understand
data.body: These pens are smooth writing. They do get the normal glob sometimes due to inuse them at work and it's in my shirt pocket. But the thing I don't understand is why the end with the clicker pops off when it wants to. I work in a factory setting so if it pops off at the wrong time it can get lost especially the little parts. So again great pen jus a tab bit bad setup.

data.body: After reading the reviews I just had to get these pens. Unfortunately I am not impressed with the quality. Being a 1.0 I was expecting it to write thick but it doesnt. It writes more like a 0.5, will be giving away and going back to the Pilot.

data.title: AS ADVERTISED.

data.title: Smooth pens

data.title: I've handed out 40 of these pens to 7 servers and who knows how many customer pen thieves.
data.body:
I noticed that some of my servers were having an issue with having a pen for me to use to sign my ticket.
After a bit of interviewing, I found out that customers were taking their pens (surprise) but interestingly enough, so were other servers (due to need).

So, I decided to saturate the joint with these pens in an attempt to solve both the customer theft and fellow server "redistribution" issues to help the servers to not have to be concerned with having a pen for a customer.

Given the servers feedback, the pens are worthy for their professional use, holding up well and they almost always give me one to use for my ticket and I like them as well, a smooth writer they be.

I even designated a 'distributer' server to provide pens when I'm not around, so she gets extra pens for that purpose, and she was the person that most other servers said took pens but never gave them back.

If anyone else relates to the server's pen issues, consider doing a pen saturation project at your joint of choice.

I did a trial run with 15 of an 18 pack of these pens that I had for my own use to get the server's feedback on continuing the project and it was very positive.

That begot the purchase of the 48-pen pack.

data.title: Great writing pens at a great price.
data.body: These write very well and are perfect amt and a great price to be able to pack christmas bags for my SS class.

data.title: Exactly as ordered
data.body: Just as expected... Thank you

data.title: Smooth writing!
data.body:
I really don't care to much for the gel type pens.
Just give me a good ball point pen any day.
Zebra pens has always been one of my favorites.
They write smooth without the ink bleed you get from some pens.
Really like the fine tip for most note taking and to have in my pocket, but when I'm at my desk writing memo's, to do's, or writing my thoughts and prayers in my journal, I prefer a nice smooth medium point.
This was a decent price point for the number of pens so no complaints there

data.title: Like getting a large amount of these my favorite pens
data.body: Often find my pens missing a work I know why they work well

data.title: My favorite pens
data.body: I write with a pen all day at work and have tried many different common pen and found these to be my go to pens. They write nicely, have a smooth clicking operation, a metal clip (versus the plastic ones that break easily) and don’t have a common issue of leaking like other pens. I like that you can buy them in bulk and they’re decently priced because I sometimes break them or lose them so having replacements handy is nice.
